title: Thunderbird slows way down
content:
My Thunderbird 115.10.2 (64 bit) is lately running very slowly. Message content takes forever to show. Sometimes don't show at all. Sent messages take 20s to save.

I was thinking that my files were simply too large, so I erase everything before 2022-01-01. Where we are now: 

  Inbox            13,662 messages 3.0 gb   All Mail         22,722 messages 5.8 gb   Sent mail       5,175 messages  1.2 gb   Important    13,093 messages  3.1 gb   Other             4,700 messages (approx)

Questions: 1. Can I delete the "Important" messages, thereby perhaps freeing up 3.1 gb? In which case how do I do that?

2. Does this look like too many messages for TB? It's two and a half years worth. Like to keep it, but not at the expense of making the system so slow.

I have removed the databases twice and started with a new instance of TB, which is where we are now.

Thanks for any suggestions!

jrc

creator: torrefazione.bugella

title: OWA Outlok Send Mails Sync
content:
Unfortunately, we had to use Outlook Web App at the company until now. We finally got an IMAP option. I immediately set it up for Thunderbird :), almost everything is good..

Unfortunately, sent mails are not synchronized 

 What I send on the Outlook Web App interface does not appear in the sent folder of thunderbird.  What I send with Thunderbird does not appear in the sent folder of Outlook Web App....

I received the following information from support: There are two directories "Sent" and "Sent Elements" in your email box directory structure. Actually it looks like when you send an email with thunderbird the email is in the "sent" directory of thunderbird and in the "sent" directory of the owa interface. When you send an email with the owa interface the email is in the "sent elements" directory of the owa interface and for some reason, which I don't know, this directory was not imported in thunderbird and is not synchronized with the email server.

Thank you for reading
creator: viktor39

title: Error when trying to setup Thunderbird
content:
When trying to configure my gmx.com email with Thunderbird I get this message when trying to create a new account.

Component returned failure code: 0x80004005 ▲ (NS_ERROR_FAILURE) [nsIMsgAccountManager.createIncomingServer]

I have set the email up many times before just never with Thunderbird on a Linux setup so I am not too sure what would be causing this, trying to find help for this I come across the same issue with varying differences. At first I thought it maybe my firewall but I disabled it and tried again and still same error. Any help much appreciated.

title: Migrating local folders.
content: I am moving Thunderbird to a new PC, old was Win 10, new is Win 11. I installed Thunderbird on the new one, same version 115.10.2 though this is now 64 bit, old was 32 bit. I followed the instructions to move the profile by copying the Thunderbird folder onto aUSB stick then copying it to the new computer. The address book is there, but the local folders I had are not. Looking inFile explorer, I see that the Local Folders folder is there which contains all the folders I had, all populated, but there is also a Local Folders-1 there which does not, and this is the one Thunderbird is using. If I delete this folder, next time I start Thunderbird, it creates this folder again. I have obviously done something wrong, but cannot see what it is.

title: Calendar - Agenda - Scheduler
content: Ao enviar convite do Thunderbird, quem recebe em Outlook tem a hora de inicio para uma hora antes. Exemplo, enviei invite para duas pessoas para reunião às 14h, uma usa Thunderbird, outra Outlook. A pessoa que recebe em Thunderbird recebe para 14h, mas a pessoa com Outlook recebe 13h. Isso acontece quando se usa o Fuso horário América/São Paulo. Se for trocado para America/Recife, as duas recebem para 14h. Observação: São Paulo e Recife fazem parte do mesmo fuso horário. Deve ser prevista a adição da timezone Brasilia no Thunderbird, pois o Outlook não tem timezone São Paulo, talvez resolva.

title: EDIT button in Calendar Event window not visible
content:
Been using Thunderbird/Lightning for many years. In the latest update (115.10.1 (64 bit)), the EDIT button is not initially visible when I click on an event in my Calendar. In past releases, this edit button has always been visible in the pop-up window when I try to edit info in a New Event task. This happens SOME of the time, but not all. Any idea what changed, and is it possible to check out the code and change it back so when I double-click on an event, I see the edit button. At this time (not a big deal, but slows me down), when I go to edit an event, I have to move to a different monitor, resize the pop-up window so I can see the EDIT button, then finally click on it to edit the Event. In the past, the cursor immediately went to the EDIT button. Any info on changing this back the old way would be appreciated.

Chas Pearson

title: Problems deleting multiple emails at once since TB 115.10.2
content:
Good day Mozilla vols! Has anyone else heard of, or developed an issue recently where TB will not delete multiple emails when selected? Previously, when I selected multiple emails for deletion and clicked "delete selected messages", TB would hang for a bit (while processing), but then all my selected messages would be deleted from both TB and my mail provider.

With timing conspicuously aligning to the 115.10.2 update, the multiple email delete functionality has broken. Now, when I highlight multiple emails to delete, instead of deleting them, TB marks them all as read, and only deletes a single email (the oldest email in the group I selected).

I saw one other question about this, but it was marked "archived" without an answer. Any thoughts/suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

Mail provider: gmail OS: Win 11 Security: Windows Security (old Windows Defender) TB client (now) 115.10.2 Troubleshooting mode (with controls reset and add-ons disabled) did not resolve the problem
creator: mark.ogletree
